roleset.name: attach

example.name: plural arg1
example.text: Machines using the 486 are expected to challenge higher-priced work stations and minicomputers in applications such as so-called servers, which-1 *trace*-1 connect groups of computers together, and in computer-aided design.

example.name: conjoined arg1's
example.text: It is a maze of halls that-1 *trace*-1 connects film rooms, elaborate spas and weight-training centers that testify to a richer, more free-spending era.
example.arg: film rooms, elaborate spas and weight-training centers that testify to a richer, more free-spending era

example.name: split arg1's
example.text: The subsidiary also increased reserves by $140 million, however, and set aside an additional $25 million for claims-1 connected *trace*-1 with Hurricane Hugo.

example.name: with instrument
example.text: John connected the fragments of his coffee cup with duct tape.
example.arg: the fragments of his coffee cup

roleset.note: Based on financial subcorpus, automatic expansion via verbnet; adjectival 'connected' based on BOLT-7. Member of VNcls mix-22.1-2-1, tape-22.4

example.name: adjectival rel: connected
example.text: These two figures , 7.5 % and 4 % , are closely connected and interact with each other . There is not only objective and practical planning , but also focus on people 's livelihood .
